definition: to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)

sentences.english: Still have to wipe my own arse though so needs more work.
sentences.chinese: 但是依然得自己擦屁股，所以需要再接再厲。

sentences.english: After the first victory, our army followed through to win every battle.
sentences.chinese: 我軍初戰勝利後再接再厲，打贏了以後的每一仗。

sentences.english: He followed up his success and started looking for new markets.
sentences.chinese: 他獲得成功之後再接再厲，又開始尋找新市場了。

sentences.english: We, yinbao people will certainly work harder to achieved more as well.
sentences.chinese: 我們銀寶人一定會再接再厲，做出更好的產品。

sentences.english: Smiles is a good test it, test had no choice but to continue the bad.
sentences.chinese: 考好的呢就是笑逐顏開，考壞的只好再接再厲了。

definition: to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
to repay a favor/to give back/feedback
to develop/to make full use of
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
